intro: Eriogonum soliceps, commonly known as the sticky yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are clustered in spherical inflorescences. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe habitats. Eriogonum soliceps is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus.
